junidDvmrpStdMIB.name: junidDvmrpStdMIB

revisions.description: Initial version, published as RFC xxxx (to be filled in by RFC-Editor).

junidDvmrpStdMIB.contactinfo: Dave Thaler Microsoft One Microsoft Way Redmond, WA 98052-6399 EMail: dthaler@microsoft.com
junidDvmrpStdMIB.description: The MIB module for management of DVMRP routers.

junidDvmrpVersionString.name: junidDvmrpVersionString
junidDvmrpVersionString.description: The router's DVMRP version information. Similar to sysDescr in MIB-II, this is a free-form field which can be used to display vendor-specific information.

junidDvmrpGenerationId.name: junidDvmrpGenerationId
junidDvmrpGenerationId.description: The generation identifier for the routing process. This is used by neighboring routers to detect whether the DVMRP routing table should be resent.

junidDvmrpNumRoutes.name: junidDvmrpNumRoutes
junidDvmrpNumRoutes.description: The number of entries in the routing table. This can be used to monitor the routing table size to detect illegal advertisements of unicast routes.

junidDvmrpReachableRoutes.name: junidDvmrpReachableRoutes
junidDvmrpReachableRoutes.description: The number of entries in the routing table with non infinite metrics. This can be used to detect network partitions by observing the ratio of reachable routes to total routes.

junidDvmrpInterfaceTable.name: junidDvmrpInterfaceTable
junidDvmrpInterfaceTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's multicast- capable interfaces.

junidDvmrpInterfaceEntry.name: junidDvmrpInterfaceEntry
junidDvmrpInterfaceEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the junidDvmrpInterfaceTable. This row augments ipMRouteInterfaceEntry in the IP Multicast MIB, where the threshold object resides.

junidDvmrpInterfaceIfIndex.name: junidDvmrpInterfaceIfIndex
junidDvmrpInterfaceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of the interface for which DVMRP is enabled.

junidDvmrpInterfaceLocalAddress.name: junidDvmrpInterfaceLocalAddress
junidDvmrpInterfaceLocalAddress.description: The IP address this system will use as a source address on this interface. On unnumbered interfaces, it must be the same value as junidDvmrpInterfaceLocalAddress for some interface on the system.

junidDvmrpInterfaceMetric.name: junidDvmrpInterfaceMetric
junidDvmrpInterfaceMetric.description: The distance metric for this interface which is used to calculate distance vectors.

junidDvmrpInterfaceStatus.name: junidDvmrpInterfaceStatus
junidDvmrpInterfaceStatus.description: The status of this entry. Creating the entry enables DVMRP on the virtual interface; destroying the entry or setting it to notInService disables DVMRP on the virtual interface.

junidDvmrpInterfaceRcvBadPkts.name: junidDvmrpInterfaceRcvBadPkts
junidDvmrpInterfaceRcvBadPkts.description: The number of DVMRP messages received on the interface by the DVMRP process which were subsequently discarded as invalid (e.g. invalid packet format, or a route report from an unknown neighbor).

junidDvmrpInterfaceRcvBadRoutes.name: junidDvmrpInterfaceRcvBadRoutes
junidDvmrpInterfaceRcvBadRoutes.description: The number of routes, in valid DVMRP packets, which were ignored because the entry was invalid.

junidDvmrpInterfaceSentRoutes.name: junidDvmrpInterfaceSentRoutes
junidDvmrpInterfaceSentRoutes.description: The number of routes, in DVMRP Report packets, which have been sent on this interface. Together with junidDvmrpNeighborRcvRoutes at a peer, this object is useful for detecting routes being lost.

junidDvmrpInterfaceInterfaceKey.name: junidDvmrpInterfaceInterfaceKey
junidDvmrpInterfaceInterfaceKey.description: The (shared) key for authenticating neighbors on this interface. This object is intended solely for the purpose of setting the interface key, and MUST be accessible only via requests using both authentication and privacy. The agent MAY report an empty string in response to get, get- next, get-bulk requests.

junidDvmrpInterfaceInterfaceKeyVersion.name: junidDvmrpInterfaceInterfaceKeyVersion
junidDvmrpInterfaceInterfaceKeyVersion.description: The highest version number of all known interface keys for this interface used for authenticating neighbors.

junidDvmrpNeighborTable.name: junidDvmrpNeighborTable
junidDvmrpNeighborTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's DVMRP neighbors, as discovered by receiving DVMRP messages.

junidDvmrpNeighborEntry.name: junidDvmrpNeighborEntry
junidDvmrpNeighborEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the junidDvmrpNeighborTable.

junidDvmrpNeighborIfIndex.name: junidDvmrpNeighborIfIndex
junidDvmrpNeighborIfIndex.description: The value of ifIndex for the virtual interface used to reach this DVMRP neighbor.

junidDvmrpNeighborAddress.name: junidDvmrpNeighborAddress
junidDvmrpNeighborAddress.description: The IP address of the DVMRP neighbor for which this entry contains information.

junidDvmrpNeighborUpTime.name: junidDvmrpNeighborUpTime
junidDvmrpNeighborUpTime.description: The time since this DVMRP neighbor (last) became a neighbor of the local router.

junidDvmrpNeighborExpiryTime.name: junidDvmrpNeighborExpiryTime
junidDvmrpNeighborExpiryTime.description: The minimum time remaining before this DVMRP neighbor will be aged out.

junidDvmrpNeighborMajorVersion.name: junidDvmrpNeighborMajorVersion
junidDvmrpNeighborMajorVersion.description: The neighboring router's major DVMRP version number.

junidDvmrpNeighborMinorVersion.name: junidDvmrpNeighborMinorVersion
junidDvmrpNeighborMinorVersion.description: The neighboring router's minor DVMRP version number.

junidDvmrpNeighborCapabilities.name: junidDvmrpNeighborCapabilities
junidDvmrpNeighborCapabilities.description: This object describes the neighboring router's capabilities. The leaf bit indicates that the neighbor has only one interface with neighbors. The prune bit indicates that the neighbor supports pruning. The generationID bit indicates that the neighbor sends its generationID in Probe messages. The mtrace bit indicates that the neighbor can handle mtrace requests.

junidDvmrpNeighborRcvRoutes.name: junidDvmrpNeighborRcvRoutes
junidDvmrpNeighborRcvRoutes.description: The total number of routes received in valid DVMRP packets received from this neighbor. This can be used to diagnose problems such as unicast route injection, as well as giving an indication of the level of DVMRP route exchange activity.

junidDvmrpNeighborRcvBadPkts.name: junidDvmrpNeighborRcvBadPkts
junidDvmrpNeighborRcvBadPkts.description: The number of packet received from this neighbor which were discarded as invalid.

junidDvmrpNeighborRcvBadRoutes.name: junidDvmrpNeighborRcvBadRoutes
junidDvmrpNeighborRcvBadRoutes.description: The number of routes, in valid DVMRP packets received from this neighbor, which were ignored because the entry was invalid.

junidDvmrpRouteTable.name: junidDvmrpRouteTable
junidDvmrpRouteTable.description: The table of routes learned through DVMRP route exchange.

junidDvmrpRouteEntry.name: junidDvmrpRouteEntry
junidDvmrpRouteEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) containing the multicast routing information used by DVMRP in place of the unicast routing information.

junidDvmrpRouteSource.name: junidDvmrpRouteSource
junidDvmrpRouteSource.description: The network address which when combined with the corresponding value of junidDvmrpRouteSourceMask identifies the sources for which this entry contains multicast routing information.

junidDvmrpRouteSourceMask.name: junidDvmrpRouteSourceMask
junidDvmrpRouteSourceMask.description: The network mask which when combined with the corresponding value of junidDvmrpRouteSource identifies the sources for which this entry contains multicast routing information.

junidDvmrpRouteUpstreamNeighbor.name: junidDvmrpRouteUpstreamNeighbor
junidDvmrpRouteUpstreamNeighbor.description: The address of the upstream neighbor (e.g., RPF neighbor) from which IP datagrams from these sources are received.

junidDvmrpRouteIfIndex.name: junidDvmrpRouteIfIndex
junidDvmrpRouteIfIndex.description: The value of ifIndex for the interface on which IP datagrams sent by these sources are received. A value of 0 typically means the route is an aggregate for which no next- hop interface exists.

junidDvmrpRouteMetric.name: junidDvmrpRouteMetric
junidDvmrpRouteMetric.description: The distance in hops to the source subnet.

junidDvmrpRouteExpiryTime.name: junidDvmrpRouteExpiryTime
junidDvmrpRouteExpiryTime.description: The minimum amount of time remaining before this entry will be aged out.

junidDvmrpRouteUpTime.name: junidDvmrpRouteUpTime
junidDvmrpRouteUpTime.description: The time since the route represented by this entry was learned by the router.

junidDvmrpRouteNextHopTable.name: junidDvmrpRouteNextHopTable
junidDvmrpRouteNextHopTable.description: The (conceptual) table containing information on the next hops on outgoing interfaces for routing IP multicast datagrams.

junidDvmrpRouteNextHopEntry.name: junidDvmrpRouteNextHopEntry
junidDvmrpRouteNextHopEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the list of next hops on outgoing interfaces to which IP multicast datagrams from particular sources are routed.

junidDvmrpRouteNextHopSource.name: junidDvmrpRouteNextHopSource
junidDvmrpRouteNextHopSource.description: The network address which when combined with the corresponding value of junidDvmrpRouteNextHopSourceMask identifies the sources for which this entry specifies a next hop on an outgoing interface.

junidDvmrpRouteNextHopSourceMask.name: junidDvmrpRouteNextHopSourceMask
junidDvmrpRouteNextHopSourceMask.description: The network mask which when combined with the corresponding value of junidDvmrpRouteNextHopSource identifies the sources for which this entry specifies a next hop on an outgoing interface.

junidDvmrpRouteNextHopIfIndex.name: junidDvmrpRouteNextHopIfIndex
junidDvmrpRouteNextHopIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of the interface for the outgoing interface for this next hop.

junidDvmrpRouteNextHopType.name: junidDvmrpRouteNextHopType
junidDvmrpRouteNextHopType.description: Type is leaf if no downstream dependent neighbors exist on the outgoing virtual interface. Otherwise, type is branch.

junidDvmrpPruneTable.name: junidDvmrpPruneTable
junidDvmrpPruneTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's upstream prune state.

junidDvmrpPruneEntry.name: junidDvmrpPruneEntry
junidDvmrpPruneEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the junidDvmrpPruneTable.

junidDvmrpPruneGroup.name: junidDvmrpPruneGroup
junidDvmrpPruneGroup.description: The group address which has been pruned.

junidDvmrpPruneSource.name: junidDvmrpPruneSource
junidDvmrpPruneSource.description: The address of the source or source network which has been pruned.

junidDvmrpPruneSourceMask.name: junidDvmrpPruneSourceMask
junidDvmrpPruneSourceMask.description: The address of the source or source network which has been pruned. The mask must either be all 1's, or else junidDvmrpPruneSource and junidDvmrpPruneSourceMask must match junidDvmrpRouteSource and junidDvmrpRouteSourceMask for some entry in the junidDvmrpRouteTable.

junidDvmrpPruneExpiryTime.name: junidDvmrpPruneExpiryTime
junidDvmrpPruneExpiryTime.description: The amount of time remaining before this prune should expire at the upstream neighbor. This value should be the minimum of the default prune lifetime and the remaining prune lifetimes of the local router's downstream neighbors, if any.

junidDvmrpNeighborLoss.name: junidDvmrpNeighborLoss
junidDvmrpNeighborLoss.description: A junidDvmrpNeighborLoss trap signifies the loss of a 2-way adjacency with a neighbor. This trap should be generated when the neighbor state changes from active to one-way, ignoring, or down. The trap should be generated only if the router has no other neighbors on the same interface with a lower IP address than itself.

junidDvmrpNeighborNotPruning.name: junidDvmrpNeighborNotPruning
junidDvmrpNeighborNotPruning.description: A junidDvmrpNeighborNotPruning trap signifies that a non-pruning neighbor has been detected (in an implementation-dependent manner). This trap should be generated at most once per generation ID of the neighbor. For example, it should be generated at the time a neighbor is first heard from if the prune bit is not set in its capabilities. It should also be generated if the local system has the ability to tell that a neighbor which sets the the prune bit in its capabilities is not pruning any branches over an extended period of time. The trap should be generated only if the router has no other neighbors on the same interface with a lower IP address than itself.

junidDvmrpMIBCompliance.name: junidDvmrpMIBCompliance
junidDvmrpMIBCompliance.description: The compliance statement for the DVMRP MIB.

junidDvmrpGeneralGroup.name: junidDvmrpGeneralGroup
junidDvmrpGeneralGroup.description: A collection of objects used to describe general DVMRP configuration information.

junidDvmrpInterfaceGroup.name: junidDvmrpInterfaceGroup
junidDvmrpInterfaceGroup.description: A collection of objects used to describe DVMRP interface configuration and statistics.

junidDvmrpNeighborGroup.name: junidDvmrpNeighborGroup
junidDvmrpNeighborGroup.description: A collection of objects used to describe DVMRP peer configuration and statistics.

junidDvmrpRoutingGroup.name: junidDvmrpRoutingGroup
junidDvmrpRoutingGroup.description: A collection of objects used to store the DVMRP routing table.

junidDvmrpSecurityGroup.name: junidDvmrpSecurityGroup
junidDvmrpSecurityGroup.description: A collection of objects used to store information related to DVMRP security.

junidDvmrpTreeGroup.name: junidDvmrpTreeGroup
junidDvmrpTreeGroup.description: A collection of objects used to store information related to DVMRP prune state.

junidDvmrpNotificationGroup.name: junidDvmrpNotificationGroup
junidDvmrpNotificationGroup.description: A collection of notifications for signaling important DVMRP events.
